1.text: Choose bok choy with bright green leaves and crisp stalks.

2.text: Buy baby bok choy for a milder flavor.

3.text: Store your bok choy in a plastic bag in the fridge for up to 5 days.

4.text: Trim and discard the thick base of the bok choy stem.

5.text: Wash the individual bok choy stalks in a bowl of cold water.

6.text: Bunch the stalks together and slice off the white stems.

7.text: Hold the bok choy in a stable position using a claw-like grip.

8.text: Hold your knife at a 45 degree angle over the bok choy stems.

9.text: Slice the bok choy into 1 in (2.5 cm) sections.

10.text: Cut an individual stalk in half down the middle.

11.text: Separate the green leaves from the white stem.

12.text: Cut the stem into 1 in (2.5 cm) long rectangular pieces.

13.text: Cut the leaves off of the bok choy.

14.text: Slice the stem vertically into 3 long strips.

15.text: Cut the strips horizontally into small 1⁄2 in (1.3 cm) long diced pieces.
